Hook looked at the scanners in disbelief. "Lord Havotron, there is a
strange energy reading in front of the Autobots." He announced, turning
around to look at Havotron. "Request Permission to turn us around."
Scrapper said in his raspy voice, a little bit worried. 

"No" Havotron commanded. "Follow them." He ordered.

Apeface walked up beside, "That wise Havotron?" he asked. "We could be
torn up." 

Havotron gave Apeface an unfriendly glare. "Your worries are noted
Apeface, and ignored." he said rather grimly. 

Slugslinger aproached. "But we could be killed. I'm not willing to risk
my life for some dead cause." he pleaded. Havotron stood up, and fired
his cannon at Slugslinger, the beam of energy ricochaing off of his
shoulder, sending him to the ground in a heap of smoke. 

"Any one else want to question our mission?" Unitron asked. 

Hook stood for a second pleading, "Havotron, you could damage our ship
if you fire agaahhhhhhhhh." Hook screamed in pain as he was met by the
same power to his chest, he fell over twitching.

Havotron stood there, his cannon fuming. "Soundwave, take Hook's place,
Nightmare, get Hook out of the way." he ordered. "Anyone else want to
taste my power?" At that most of the Decepticons cowered. Spinister
walked up quietly towards Havotron, catching him of guard. Havotron
turned the cannon on Spinister, who camly pointed at the screen, showing
the Autobot shuttle. 

"Yes, you have a point. The Autobots are the enemy. Continue on the
course." he said, calming down, and sitting down. 

Nightmare, walked up, and pulled Hook out of the way.
